input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Manager

Location: Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Management

Description:
Engineering Manager
This is a full-time position and not open to contract work.
Company Overview
b.well is transforming how healthcare consumers find and receive care in a personalized, convenient, and affordable manner. Partnering with our customers (health systems, insurance payors, pharmacies, and employers), we empower consumers to make informed choices about their family’s health using our data platform and our mobile apps.
We’re searching for experienced Engineering Managers looking to apply their technology and leadership talents to help fix America’s largest (and most broken) industry. As a Engineering Manager at b.well you will be immediately engaged in an opportunity to create impactful solutions that will delight millions of consumers globally.
This position is available for fully remote work.
     Team Overview 
The Health Programs portfolio’s mission focuses on engaging a user with insights and actions designed to improve their health and well-being while reducing the burden of healthcare. We create tools to enable both our team and others to effectively engage with our users. The recommendations and communications we generate are personalized based on a user’s personal health information and specific care needs. 
What You'll Do: 
Coach, manage, and engage with a team of 4 to 6 engineers in delivery of solutions throughout the full software development life-cycleHelp to architect solutions, enable rapid innovation and continuous delivery of Healthcare products, while ensuring high-quality, resiliency, and efficiency in operationsOn occasion, step in and write clean, well tested codeAttract, hire, and develop high-performing engineering talentCollaborate directly with product managers, customers, and cross-functional teams to innovate and execute on an iterative plans that continuously delivers customer valueDrive delivery of industry leading applications & services to healthcare consumersChampion and drive improvements to team software engineering practicesFoster an inspirational culture of excellence, learning, and fun
Job Requirements: 
3+ years of experience in technology leadership creating & delivering exceptional consumer solutions3+ years of mastered experience in prevalent Web, Cloud, Microservice, and Database technologies serving a high-scale 24x7 internet business3+ years experience leading and managing high performance talent, amidst startup cultureA successful candidate must be a coach in the code with hands-on, lead-by-example, bias for action for great solutions, architecture, code, processes, and operationsProven communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work across the organizationProven ability to manage high levels of ambiguity with iterative, agile leadership and technology approachExperience in applying technology patterns, frameworks, principles, best practices, and skills across the organization, with bias for customer & business valueExperience in continuous integration, continuous delivery, continuous 24x7 operations, and a culture of continuous improvement
Technology Experience desired:Note, these are not requirements, experience with similar technologies is sufficient
Front-End: ReactJS, GraphQL, Micro Frontend Architecture, MaterialUIMobile: iOS, Android, React NativeBack-End: Spring/Java, Kafka, Django/Python, NodeJSLangs: Java, Typescript, CQLDatabase: Mongo, MySQLDevOps: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, JIRA, GitHub, DataDog, GrafanaAPIs: REST, GraphQL
Great to Have: 
Experience in digital health industry especially FHIR and CQLEHR integration experience and/or telehealth platform integrationsStartup experience, for rapid growthEnterprise experience, for platform scale
Data shows that women, people of color, and other underrepresented groups may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they are a perfect match. But b.well holds diversity amongst its key values, and we have a strong commitment to building our workforce and products through that lens.
You don't have to check every box in this job description to be a great fit for the role! If you're excited about this position and the prospect of working for b.well, please apply. If it turns out this role isn't for you, there may be other openings that could align with your experience and expertise!
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse b.well. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.

Experience Level (if available): Director

output_json.title: Engineering Manager
output_json.summary: Full-time position for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead a team of engineers in developing healthcare solutions.
job_responsibilities: Coach, manage, and engage with a team of 4 to 6 engineers in delivery of solutions throughout the full software development life-cycle
Help to architect solutions, enable rapid innovation and continuous delivery of Healthcare products
Ensure high-quality, resiliency, and efficiency in operations
Attract, hire, and develop high-performing engineering talent
Collaborate directly with product managers, customers, and cross-functional teams to innovate and execute on an iterative plans that continuously delivers customer value
Drive delivery of industry leading applications & services to healthcare consumers
Champion and drive improvements to team software engineering practices
Foster an inspirational culture of excellence, learning, and fun

Partnering with our customers (health systems, insurance payors, pharmacies, and employers), we empower consumers to make informed choices about their family’s health using our data platform and our mobile apps.

We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.
